DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether intraoperative computer-assisted navigation improve prosthetic implant positioning compare conventional intraoperatve instrumentation Total Knee Arthroplasty ( TKA ) .
DOC.detailed_description: Primary data obtain determine whether mechanical axis limb malignment differs patient computer-assisted TKA treat conventional intraoperative instrumentation . Three month surgery follow-up radiographic data provide evidence initial implant position determine series x-ray include : full length standing , standard AP weight bearing , lateral , patellar , kneelingfilm view CT evaluation . In addition , correlation betweeen CT measure kneel x-ray perform time . Clinical ( Knee Scale Society , WOMAC , SF-36 ) data also obtain three month interval .
DOC.criteria: Study participant must : 1 . Be 18 year age . 2 . Require TKA consider investigator suitable candidate specific knee prosthesis identify protocol . 3 . The subject give consent transfer his/her information sponsor .
